intro: Arctotis pannucea, commonly known as the silverleaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray, fuzzy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its showy, daisy-like flowers range in color from yellow to orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Arctotis pannucea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and striking appearance.
